posts.title: KEEPING YOU CONNECTED - Month 2021 Newsletter
posts.desc:
Life can get busy! In our latest newsletter, we hope to make it easier for you to stay connected and keep informed. As always, we would love to hear your feedback, questions, or suggestions for future topics. Happy reading!

Topic #1 | Topic #2 | Topic #3 | Topic #4

posts.title: New Customized Post - Introduction to Newsletter and Personal note
posts.desc:
This is a good place to give a personal note to your audience. Talk about the state of the world, how your office is holding up, relevant and timely events. Keep this introduction short, to the point, and useful - or opt to leave it out.

Example: Our office is back in full swing! Following regular Covid protocols, we are excited to welcome you back. 

Example: This past quarter our team has been keeping busy. We've participated in this community event, or supported that fundraiser. 

Example: On a personal side, Advisor Joe has a new member of his family - meet Fido the 6month old puppy.  Assistant Jim welcomed his first grandchild. Associate Jane completed a course in customer service.

posts.title: BUSINESS NEWS & UPDATES
posts.desc: We're working hard to keep you informed on the latest financial and business news and updates from our office and around the country.

posts.title: New Customized Post 1 - Business Update
posts.desc:
This section is a great addition for updates on your business, or the markets in general. It gives you the opportunity to mention any important world events, how you are handling them, and any business updates to be aware of. You can create a custom blog post with full details to link to, or link to an external website page - or give a short informative post directly in the newsletter. Keep posts short, and easily digestible!   

Here are some examples:

  • New features to products, Process or Tools like Client Portals and online forms, or digital enhancements
  • Heads up for any emails, notifications, or information they may be getting
  • Changes to Business Hours, Location, Booking availability, etc.

posts.title: CONTENT SEPARATOR - HEADING
posts.desc: Use this separator if you feel there is too much information, or you want to segment the posts with Headings. You can remove this section if it is not needed.
